text: English mini lesson number 10 topic
Groundhog Day how much do you know about
Groundhog Day I hope through this video
you'll learn something new about this
fun holiday but I'm not going to be the
one who will teach you
I've asked my colleague and fellow
youtuber to tell you what she knows
about Groundhog Day so allow me to
introduce you to Stacey from the channel
English with Stacey what is a groundhog
listen and learn the answer well it's a
small animal that lives underground in
the winter it looks kind of like a
beaver I could tell you it's a woodchuck
but that's probably not very helpful I
would look for a picture on the Internet
according to Stacey what is not true
groundhogs live underground
groundhogs hibernate meaning sleep
during winter or groundhog is another
name for beaver this last statement is
not true a groundhog and a beaver are
not the same animal though some people
might think that a groundhog and a
beaver look similar so here are three
truths about groundhogs they live
underground they hibernate meaning they
sleep during winter and they are also
called woodchucks and whistle pigs but
not beavers what is groundhog day listen
and learn the answer it's not February
2nd the groundhog comes out of its hole
and if it sees clouds it means winter
will soon be over but if it sees Sun it
means but it can see its shadow and
there will be another six weeks of
winter I honestly have no idea where
this holiday came from
when is Groundhog Day February 1st
February 2nd or the second Monday of
February
Groundhog Day is on February 2nd what
happens on Groundhog Day which statement
below is true the groundhog predicts
either the end of winter or the coming
of spring the groundhogs appearance is
part of the celebration of winter or if
the groundhog is seen under a cloudy sky
bad luck will come in the spring
this first statement is the correct one
as Stacey explained the groundhog is
used to make a prediction if the
groundhog sees its shadow there will be
six more weeks of winter if the
groundhog doesn't see its shadow spring
will come early
as for the origin of Groundhog Day it's
commonly thought that this holiday was
based on European traditions that were
brought over by immigrants where is the
holiday celebrated listen and learn the
answer a lot of people go to the town of
pucks to Tom Pennsylvania where a famous
groundhog lives I think his name is Phil
they have a big celebration and they
wait to see what he will do I think it's
something that's more well known in the
Northeast I grew up on the west coast
and to be honest I didn't know much
about this holiday until I saw the movie
Groundhog Day
true or false Groundhog Day is only
celebrated in the northeastern region of
the United States the answer is false
Stacey said this holiday is probably
more well known in the Northeast but it
is celebrated in the US the whole
country and in Canada it's not a major
holiday but it's an official one and
it's listed on the calendar it's also
very popular in a small town called
Punxsutawney Punxsutawney Pennsylvania
where one of the most famous groundhogs
Punxsutawney Phil lives in this town
Punxsutawney is featured in the
Hollywood film Groundhog Day let's have
some pronunciation practice listen and
repeat the following is a very
well-known tongue twister in English
almost every American child learns this
tongue twister
let me first read it and then I'll help
you learn it how much wood would a
woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could
chuck wood note - Chuck means to throw -
toss so it's about a woodchuck or a
groundhog tossing wood throwing bits of
wood now repeat after me we'll take it
first in small parts how much wood would
a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could
chuck wood
now let's try longer lines how much wood
would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck
could chuck wood let's try it
all together at a slow pace ready how
much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a

again a little faster how much wood
would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck
could chuck wood do you think you can go

chuck wood how did you do well if you
